SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
SALESFORCE ORDER MANAGEMENT
Order Product Adjustment Line Item Fields

The Order Product Adjustment Line Item object represents an adjustment to the price of an order product, usually a discount. In Order Management, you usually interact with order product adjustment summaries instead of order product adjustments.

REQUIRED EDITIONS
Available in: Lightning Experience
Available in: Enterprise, Unlimited, and Developer Editions
NOTE Depending on your page layout and field-level security settings, some fields aren’t visible or editable.

This table lists the fields on the Order Product Adjustment Line Item object.

FIELD LABEL	DESCRIPTION
Adjustment Cause	The promotion associated with the adjustment line item.
Amount	The total amount of the adjustment line item.
Created By	The user who created the order product adjustment line item record.
Created Date	The date and time that the order product adjustment line item record was created.
Description	The description of the adjustment line item.
Last Modified By	The user who last changed the order product adjustment line item record.
Last Modified Date	The date when the order product adjustment line item record was last changed.
Name	The name of the adjustment line item.
Order Adjustment Group	The order adjustment group that contains the order product adjustment line item.
Order Product	The order product to which the adjustment line item applies.
Product Adjustment Line Item	
Related Order Product Adjustment Line Item	The original order product adjustment line item. Used for reference when a change order is created.
Total Amount with Tax	

The total amount, including tax, for the order product adjustment line item.

Total Amount with Tax = Amount + Total Tax


Total Tax	The tax on the amount.
